abstract: Sec of State John Kerry meets with Uzbekistan Pres Islam Karimov as part of Obama administration's effort to build economic partnership with five Central Asian states; Kerry faces challenge of presenting United States as nonthreatening alternative to Pres Vladimir V Putin's Russia, which requires overlooking human rights violations of Uzbekistan government, seven-year strategy that has so far failed to influence Karimov's government for better.
lead_paragraph: On the second stop of a Central Asian tour, Mr. Kerry found himself struggling over how hard, and how publicly, to press one of the harshest authoritarian governments in the world.

headline.main: John Kerry Is Cautious on Human Rights During Uzbekistan Visit
headline.print_headline: Kerry Is Muted on Human Rights in Uzbekistan

snippet: On the second stop of a Central Asian tour, Mr. Kerry found himself struggling over how hard, and how publicly, to press one of the harshest authoritarian governments in the world.

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject
